intro: Caroselinum chabraei, commonly known as the Kashmir saffron, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Crocus genus, which includes various species of flowering plants in the Iridaceae family. The plant is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and is known for its medicinal properties. Its bulbs are traditionally used in Ayurvedic medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to habitat loss and over-harvesting, Caroselinum chabraei is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
